intro: Anthospermum dregei subsp. dregei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences and are usually white or pale yellow. This species is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
